page.title: 11Gayton Hall Farm
page.content:
Gayton Hall Farm ****************
Gayton Hall Farm, which up until recent years was over 200 acres, has now been reduced to a mere 60 acres as a result of land being sold for the golf course. This however is not the only change to have occurred. From having large flocks of sheep and herds of cows the farm has since been used for market gardening. Everything about the farm now is geared towards selling. All types of crops are grown which are suitable for marketing including barley which is used as part of the crop rotation programme. Four people work the farm which comparing its size is a large ratio.
